alert.note: Alert for Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 12:47PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Quad Cities IA IL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois...Iowa... Mississippi River at Rock Island LD15 affecting Muscatine, Scott and Rock Island Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is expected in the next 5 days. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Rock Island LD15. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Water affects the lowest section of South Concord Street south of River Drive in Davenport and affects other sections in the same area. Water affects the lowest sections of the Enchanted Island causeway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 14.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Wednesday evening and continue rising to 17.6 feet Monday morning. Rises are expected to continue until at least the end of April. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
